instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after 5s with trackpad connected.
threads.message:
Cant find any corrosion around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, SMC, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, BIOS, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>.

Tested with new battery and 85W charger.
Press power button and after a few seconds shut down. No bootloop/restarts.
There is chime and it shut down just before Apple logo.

Issue is only when trackpad is connected.
Checked with new trackpad and trackpad cable and issue is the same.

Without trackpad all works fine.

J4802/28 <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> got 3.16V

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after 5s with trackpad connected.
threads.message: Remove keyboard only, let the trackpad connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after 5s with trackpad connected.
threads.message:
Same issue without keyboard.

When there is no trackpad it boots and then if I connect trackpad it shut down after a few secs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after 5s with trackpad connected.
threads.message: Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after 5s with trackpad connected.
threads.message: I just did SMS reset... and works fine now - is that possible it was as simple as SMC reset?
